required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pilot Phase for an Acute Evaluation of a Non-Implantable Electrical Continence Device
clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Phase for an Acute Evaluation of a Non-Implantable Electrical Continence Device

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this feasibility clinical investigation is to investigate a new medical device treatment for Overactive Bladder (OAB) in women.

detailed_description.textblock: The FemPulse System is a vaginal ring intended to provide mild electrical stimulation to nerves that regulate bladder function. It is believed that stimulation of these nerves may help relieve the symptoms of OAB.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Subjects will wear a device and will be monitored non-invasively during activation of the device.

primary_outcome.description: The Quantitative Sudomotor Axon Reflex Test (QSART) will be used to detect changes in autonomic nervous system activity during device activation
Surface electrodes will be used to detect whether evoked potentials are generated during device activation

arm_group.arm_group_label: Monitoring during activation of the FemPulse System
arm_group.description: Subjects will undergo non-invasive monitoring during activation of the FemPulse System.

intervention.description: Non-invasive monitoring during activation of the FemPulse System
intervention.arm_group_label: Monitoring during activation of the FemPulse System

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Normal healthy women â‰¥ 21 years old
- Using contraception if of reproductive age
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant, recently pregnant or actively trying to conceive
- Prior hysterectomy
- Current or recent urinary tract or vaginal infection
